DataElement.preferredName: Vitamin E Compound Stop Agreement Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator for whether the patient has agreed to stop taking vitamin E.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A fat-soluble vitamin which is primarily a chain-breaking antioxidant that prevents the propagation of lipid peroxidation._Put an end to a state or an activity._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A fat-soluble vitamin which is primarily a chain-breaking antioxidant that prevents the propagation of lipid peroxidation.

Concepts.definition: A natural fat-soluble antioxidant with potential chemopreventive activity. Also known as tocopherol, vitamin E ameliorates free-radical damage to biological membranes, protecting polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFA) within membrane phospholipids and within circulating lipoproteins. Peroxyl radicals react 1000-fold faster with vitamin E than with PUFA.  In the case of oxygen free radical-mediated tumorigenesis, vitamin E may be chemopreventive. (NCI04)

Property.preferredDefinition: Put an end to a state or an activity.:1. The act of agreeing. 2. Harmony of opinion; accord. (from American Heritage Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Put an end to a state or an activity.
The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concomitant Medication per CDISC CM Definition
